;

;周三，以色列士兵在袭击 Al Shifa 医院时打死了几名哈马斯武装分子，那里有数千名巴勒斯坦人平民——患者、流离失所者和医务人员——在数周的战斗中被困。

;

;以色列表示，发动这次袭击是因为哈马斯在希法地下设有一个指挥中心，并利用相连的隧道来隐藏军事行动，并扣押人质。哈马斯否认这一说法。

;

;以色列军方表示，“在进入医院之前，我们的部队遇到了爆炸装置和恐怖分子小队，随后发生了战斗，恐怖分子被打死”，但没有具体说明交火发生的具体地点。

;

;以色列陆军电台称，五名武装分子已被打死，并在 Al Shifa 营地内发现了武器。

;

;随着 Al Shifa 成为“伊斯兰国”，全球要求人道主义停火的呼声日益高涨。以色列战争的焦点是哈马斯，对被困在冲突前线的数千人的担忧与日俱增。

;

;周三早些时候，卫生部长穆尼尔·布尔什 (Munir al-Bursh) 博士表示哈马斯领导的加沙政府部门告诉半岛电视台，以色列军队袭击了医疗大楼的西侧，并认为医院内发生了爆炸。

;

;首先袭击了手术室和急诊室该部医院主任穆罕默德·扎克特 (Mohammed Zaqout) 告诉广播公司。

;

;路透社无法独立确认 Al Shifa 的情况。

;

;在一份声明中，以色列国防军 (IDF) ）表示：“根据情报信息和行动需要，以色列国防军部队正在希法医院的指定区域对哈马斯进行精确、有针对性的行动。”

;

;以色列陆军发言人彼得·勒纳中校告诉记者CNN 称，医院和大院是哈马斯“行动的中心枢纽，甚至可能是跳动的心脏，甚至可能是重心。”美国周二表示，其自己的情报支持以色列的结论。

;

;哈马斯周三表示，美国的声明实际上为以色列袭击医院开了“绿灯”。该组织表示，以色列和美国总统乔·拜登对这次行动负全部责任。

;

;“我们不支持从空中袭击医院，我们不希望看到无辜的医院发生交火。白宫国家安全委员会发言人在一份声明中表示：“人们、无助的人、试图获得应有医疗护理的病人都陷入了交火中。医院和患者必须受到保护。”

;

;以色列军队过去10天里，以色列军队与哈马斯武装分子进行了激烈的巷战，然后进入加沙市中心和阿尔希法周围。

;

;以色列军方周三表示，两名士兵昨天在加沙地带北部的战斗中丧生，自地面攻势开始以来以色列已确认死亡人数增加至 48 人。

;

;以色列誓言摧毁哈马斯，以报复武装分子 10 月 7 日跨境袭击以色列。以色列称哈马斯已杀害 1,200 人横冲直撞，并劫持了 240 多名人质。

;

;在约旦河西岸，这是一个不受哈马斯控制的独立巴勒斯坦飞地，巴勒斯坦权力机构卫生部长迈·阿尔凯拉表示，以色列“正在犯下新的危害人类罪，医务人员

;

;阿尔凯拉在一份声明中说：“我们认为占领军对希法的医务人员、患者和流离失所者的生命负全部责任。”

;

;

;Al Shifa 是一座;庞大的建筑群;和庭院距加沙城渔港仅数百米。加沙官员称，该建筑群西侧的建筑物是袭击地点，其中包括内科和透析部门。

;

;哈马斯称，650 名患者和 5,000 至 7,000 名其他平民被困在大楼内。医院场地遭到以色列狙击手和无人机的持续射击。由于燃料、水和物资短缺，最近几天已有 40 名患者死亡。

;

;;在三名婴儿死亡后，新生儿病房留下了三十六名婴儿;。由于没有发电机燃料为孵化器提供动力，婴儿们只能尽可能保持温暖，八个人排在一张床上。

;

;以色列军方周三表示：“我们可以确认孵化器、婴儿食品和医疗设备以色列国防军坦克从以色列运来的物资已成功抵达希法医院。我们的医疗队和讲阿拉伯语的士兵在现场，以确保这些物资到达有需要的人手中。”

;

;被困在医院的巴勒斯坦人;周二挖了一个乱葬坑;来埋葬死亡且没有制定计划的患者 ;解释有关保护医疗设施和在那里避难的数千名流离失所者的国际法;。

;

;以色列周三在声明中表示，已给加沙当局 12 小时的时间停止医院内的军事活动。军方声明称：“不幸的是，事实并非如此。”

;据三名人士称，伊朗最高领导人 11 月初在德黑兰会晤时向哈马斯领导人传达了明确的信息高级官员：您没有就 10 月 7 日对以色列的袭击向我们发出警告，我们不会代表您参战。

;

;阿亚图拉阿里哈梅内伊告诉伊斯梅尔哈尼亚，哈马斯的长期支持者伊朗将了解讨论情况的伊朗和哈马斯官员表示，伊朗和哈马斯官员将继续向该组织提供政治和道义支持，但不会直接干预。

;

;最高领导人向哈尼亚施压。一名哈马斯官员告诉路透社，为了平息巴勒斯坦组织中公开呼吁伊朗及其强大的黎巴嫩盟友真主党全力加入打击以色列的声音。

;

;真主党也对哈马斯上个月发动毁灭性袭击，造成 1,200 名以色列人死亡；三位与该黎巴嫩组织关系密切的消息人士称，该组织的战斗人员甚至没有在 2006 年与以色列战争前线的边境村庄处于戒备状态，因此必须迅速被召集起来。

;

;“我们醒来了真主党指挥官表示。

;

;这场正在展开的危机标志着所谓的抵抗轴心——伊朗在四十年里建立的军事联盟，旨在反对以色列和美国在中东地区的势力——首次出现。中东 - 同时在多条战线上动员起来。

;

;真主党与以色列进行了近 20 年来最激烈的冲突。伊朗支持的民兵袭击了驻伊拉克和叙利亚的美军。也门胡塞武装向以色列发射了导弹和无人机。

;

;这场冲突也考验了地区联盟的极限，该联盟的成员包括叙利亚政府、真主党、哈马斯和从伊拉克到也门的其他激进组织。贝鲁特卡内基中东中心智库的真主党专家莫哈纳德·哈格·阿里表示，哈马斯 10 月 7 日对以色列的袭击使其轴心伙伴面临艰难的选择

;

;“当你用这样的攻击唤醒熊时，你的盟友很难与你站在同一位置。”

;

;加沙统治组织哈马斯正在与复仇的以色列为生存而战，以色列誓言要消灭它，并对这片狭小的飞地发动了报复性袭击，造成 11,000 多名巴勒斯坦人死亡。

;

;关于10 月 7 日，哈马斯军事指挥官 ;Mohammed Deif; 拜会其轴心盟友也加入了斗争。他在音频信息中说：“黎巴嫩、伊朗、也门、伊拉克和叙利亚的伊斯兰抵抗运动的兄弟们，今天是你们的抵抗运动与巴勒斯坦人民团结起来的日子。”

;

;有一丝沮丧的迹象哈马斯领导人哈立德·梅沙尔 (Khaled Meshaal) 随后的公开声明中也提到了这一点，他在 10 月 16 日接受电视采访时感谢真主党迄今采取的行动，但表示“这场战斗需要更多努力”。

;

;尽管如此，联盟领导人伊朗 ;不会直接干预冲突;，除非它本身据六名直接了解德黑兰想法的官员透露，由于此事的敏感性，这些官员拒绝透露姓名。

;

;相反，伊朗的神职统治者计划继续使用他们的轴心网络官员们表示，包括真主党在内的武装盟友向以色列和美国在中东的目标发动火箭弹和无人机袭击。

;

;该战略是一项经过调整的努力，旨在展示对加沙哈马斯的声援，并扩大以色列的支持他们补充说，在不与以色列发生直接对抗的情况下，可能会将美国卷入其中。

;

;“这是他们试图形成威慑的方式，”美国前高级外交官丹尼斯·罗斯(Dennis Ross)表示。来自中东，现在在智库华盛顿近东政策研究所工作。 “这就是说：‘只要你不攻击我们，事情就会一直这样。但如果你攻击我们，一切都会改变’。”

;

;伊朗一再表示，所有联盟成员独立做出自己的决定。

;

;伊朗外交部没有回应就其对危机的反应以及“抵抗轴心”（一个起源有争议的术语）的作用发表评论的请求。伊朗官员用这个词来描述该联盟。

;

;哈马斯没有立即回应发送给哈尼亚媒体顾问的问题，而真主党也没有立即回应置评请求。

;

;哈马斯没有立即回应发送给哈尼亚媒体顾问的问题。 >;

;自哈马斯与以色列开战以来，真主党是轴心国中最强大的组织，拥有 10 万战士，几乎每天都在黎以边境与以色列军队交火，其中 70 多名战士被杀。

;

;然而，像其支持者伊朗一样，真主党避免了全面对抗。

;

;该组织已调整其袭击方式，将暴力很大程度上控制在据知情人士透露，尽管近几天来升级了袭击，但哈马斯仍控制着边境的一小片狭长领土。

;

;其中一位消息人士称，哈马斯希望真主党深入以色列境内其庞大的火箭军火库，但真主党认为这将导致以色列在不停止对加沙的攻击的情况下蹂躏黎巴嫩。

;

;真主党也是一个深度参与黎巴嫩政府事务的政治运动，了解黎巴嫩< a href="/world/middle-east/broken-lebanon-cannot-afford-war-hezbollah-knows-it-2023-10-26/">;无法承受;与以色列再次发生战争，超过四次黎巴嫩多年来一直陷入金融危机，这场危机加剧了贫困，并掏空了该国的管理机构。

;

;黎巴嫩花了数年时间才从 2006 年战争中重建，在此期间，以色列轰炸了真主党控制的该国南部并摧毁了真主党领导人赛义德·哈桑·纳斯拉拉 (Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah) 在 11 月 3 日的讲话中表示，哈马斯对其盟友隐瞒了对以色列的袭击，这确保了其在首都贝鲁特南郊的大片据点。成功而不是在轴上“让任何人感到不安”。他说，真主党对以色列边境的袭击是史无前例的，相当于“一场真正的战斗”。

;

;美国也渴望避免战争蔓延到加沙以外地区。过去二十年来，它在伊拉克和阿富汗打了两场代价高昂且命运多舛的战争，现在发现自己正在为乌克兰防御俄罗斯的入侵提供资金。

;

;迄今为止，乔·拜登总统一直试图限制美国在其中的作用。加沙危机主要是为了确保对以色列的军事援助。他还将;两艘航空母舰;和战斗机移至地中海东部，部分是作为;对德黑兰的警告;。

;

;温度不断升高；据五角大楼称，自加沙战争爆发以来，伊拉克和叙利亚轴心国民兵为回应美国对以色列的支持，已对美军发动了至少 40 次无人机和火箭袭击。美国官员表示，美国已实施三轮;报复性袭击< /a>; 针对与伊朗有联系的民兵组织在叙利亚使用的设施。

;

;周一，美国国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀强调了冲突中开辟另一条主要战线的风险。

;

;”我们在整个冲突、整个危机中看到的是黎巴嫩真主党和以色列军队之间针锋相对的交锋，”他在首尔举行的新闻发布会上说。 “没有人希望看到北方再次爆发冲突。”

;

;据报道，奥斯汀周末与以色列外长约夫·加兰特交谈时强调，需要避免任何地区局势升级。电话。

;

;以色列总理办公室没有立即回应对本文发表评论的请求。

;

;两位拒绝透露姓名的以色列安全部门消息人士表示，以色列没有不寻求任何敌对行动蔓延，但补充说，如果需要保护自己，该国准备在新战线上进行战斗。他们表示，安全官员认为对以色列最有力的直接威胁来自真主党。

;

;以色列和伊朗之间存在深厚的敌意。

;

;伊朗不承认以色列的存在，而以色列长期以来一直威胁以色列如果外交未能遏制其有争议的核活动，将对伊朗采取军事行动。

;

;卡内基国际和平基金会的伊朗问题专家卡里姆·萨贾德普尔认为，在当前的危机中，真正的政治可能会在德黑兰占上风。

;

;“伊朗已经表现出在不发生直接冲突的情况下与美国和以色列作战的四个十年的承诺。该政权的革命意识形态是基于反对美国和以色列，但其领导人并不是自杀，他们希望继续掌权。”

; Wed, 15 Nov 2023 14:25:04 +0800 Central Europe“s defence companies spy African opportunityhttps://reuters.com/article/easteurope-arms-africa/central-europes-defence-companies-spy-african-opportunity-idUSKBN32A0BW
;;2023-11-15T06:12:25Z;
;

;Central European defence companies are negotiating new deals to sell more weapons, military equipment and related services in Africa as they seek to poach customers looking for alternatives to Russia, companies and government officials say.

;

;Though now part of the Western NATO alliance, former Warsaw Pact members such as the Czech Republic, then part of Czechoslovakia, delivered a steady supply of weapons to African countries during the Communist era and so are well-placed to maintain or upgrade those systems.

;

;"The best new markets are the African ones because they still use Soviet-era equipment but now want Western technology added to it," Jiri Hynek, president and director of industry trade group the Defence and Security Industry Association of the Czech Republic, told Reuters.

;

;"We call it the westernization of Soviet products."

;

;Take Czech aircraft maker Aero Vodochody. The company is in talks to sell its L-39NG training and light attack aircraft to new buyers as well as provide upgrades for older versions, its executive vice president of sales Filip Kulstrunk told Reuters.

;

;"We see increasing interest from new potential customers, who are looking to abandon Russian or Chinese equipment and wish to westernize their armed forces," he said, declining to give details on which countries it was talking to.

;

;The Czech Republic in 2022 exported ammunition, guns, aircraft and other military supplies valued at around 32 million euros to 10 sub-Saharan African countries, many which rely on Soviet-era weapons manufactured with different standards and calibres than those used in the West. This was up from just under 2 million euros in 2011.

;

;Reuters spoke to around a half dozen Czech and Polish defence companies and government officials who described renewed efforts to carve out a bigger share of the African arms market as the Ukraine conflict diverts Russia's attention.

;

;While the companies declined for the most part to outline specifics or countries they were targeting for competitive reasons, deals being discussed included for guns, ammunition and other military equipment and services, they said.

;

;Privately-held defence and civil manufacturing company Czechoslovak Group - the biggest Czech defence company - said its ability to maintain and modernize armoured vehicles using Soviet-era standards has helped it win business in Africa.

;

;"CSG has exceptional capability to maintain and modernise military land systems of Eastern origin so that African customers needn't depend on Russian suppliers," spokesman Andrej Cirtek told Reuters. "We have already used this in a number of business cases in Africa."

;

;According to the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute, Russia overtook China as the leading arms seller in sub-Saharan Africa with a market share rising to 26% over the past five years from 2018 to 2022.

;

;While it has not yet fully processed data on all recent exports to Africa since the start of the Ukraine war, Pieter Wezeman, a senior researcher in the organisation's arms transfers programme, told Reuters that reliability concerns could spur some nations to look beyond Russia.

;

;"Czech industry has the kind of expertise on former Soviet weapons which can be useful when selling equipment, components or servicing of weapons used by African countries," he said.

;

;Sebastian Chwalek, chief executive of Poland's state-owned PGZ – which controls dozens of companies making weapons, ammunition, armoured transporters, unmanned air systems and other equipment – told Reuters the company has stepped up talks over the last 12 months to tap African markets.

;

;Polish military technology company WB Group - whose products include unmanned drones and missile systems - has also seen an uptick in interest from potential African customers on its home turf over the past year.

;

;"We attended a recent trade exposition. ...in Poland where our stand was visited by numerous delegations from African countries that appeared here for the first time," WB Group spokesman Remigiusz Wilk said.

;

;"It is always beneficial for any other supplier if someone who previously existed on a given market disappears from it, or is less represented."

;

;Underlining the push into Africa, a Czech trade mission visited Ethiopia, Kenya, Ghana and the Ivory Coast earlier this month. A key aim, said Prime Minister Petr Fiala, was boosting opportunities for the defence industry.

;

;Czech national security advisor Tomas Pojar, who took part in the trade mission, said defence deals under discussion as a result of the trip were worth billions of crowns and included talks with Ethiopia about modernizing its aircraft and upgrading Soviet technology.

;

;"Our focus is to re-open and strengthen relationships with our traditional partners in Africa by committing ourselves to what they want and need the most," he told Reuters.

;

;Tomas Kopecny, a Czech government envoy and former deputy minister of defence charged with leading business missions to Africa, added that inviting African leaders to visit Prague represented another way to stir up new defence deals.

;

;This included the Czech-speaking president of Mozambique, whose visit in August marked the first of a sub-Saharan African leader to Prague for more than two decades, he added.

;

;"One part of these activities also includes defence industry cooperation, since it has been an integral part of what we have engaged in together in the past," Kopecny said.

;

;As a nation of 10.5 million, the Czech Republic has long punched above its weight when coming to arms production and has been a leading supplier of ammunition, military equipment and other weapons to Ukraine since Russia's 2022 invasion.

;

;The effort to supply Ukraine has pushed Czech companies to boost production and expand supply lines, something Czech-based independent defence analyst Lukas Visingr said has burnished the region's reputation.

;

;"The Czech arms industry is stepping up its efforts towards certain African countries still using Soviet-style equipment but who start to see Russia as a problematic supplier," Visingr said.

;

;Just blocks from where US President Joe Biden and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping will meet other Asia-Pacific leaders this week in San Francisco is a neighborhood where it is commonplace to see people using and selling drugs.

;

;While the leaders are unlikely to see the blunt reality of the US opioid crisis as they attend the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum, it will be a topic of discussion when ;Biden and Xi meet; one-on-one on Wednesday.

;

;The United States wants China's cooperation to stop an illicit flow of "precursor" chemicals that are used to make fentanyl, which is up to 50 times stronger than heroin and is increasingly mixed with other drugs - often with lethal results.

;

;In the first nine months of this year, 619 people died of an opioid overdose in San Francisco, most related to the synthetic opioids, compared with 647 such deaths in the whole of 2022, according to the city's Office of the Chief Medical Examiner.

;

;"It's out of control," said Mike Odeh, 36, a salesperson at a liquor store near where APEC leaders will meet.

;

;He said that while the city had been cleaning up the streets ahead of APEC, he normally sees people using fentanyl while walking his son to the park and to school, adding: "You can see it all over. Not this week of course."

;

;Across the country the rate of drug overdose deaths involving fentanyl more than tripled from 2016 through 2021, according to the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Tens of thousands of people die annually from synthetic opioid overdoses, government statistics show.

;

;US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said on Tuesday that Washington hoped the Biden-Xi summit would result in action to combat the fentanyl trade. A source familiar with plans said the US ;was ready to remove; restrictions on the Institute of Forensic Science, part of China's Ministry of Public Security.

;

;Washington put the institute on the Commerce Department's "entity list" in 2020 over alleged abuses toward Uyghurs and other minority groups - effectively barring it from receiving US exports. China has long questioned why the US would expect cooperation on fentanyl while targeting the institute.

;

;China's embassy in Washington declined to comment on the fentanyl issue. Chinese state media has repeatedly said addiction and demand for the drug are US domestic problems.

;

;US officials say that small chemical businesses in China make precursor chemicals that are shipped to Mexico to produce illicit fentanyl, which is often mixed with other illegal drugs, sold as powders and nasal sprays, and increasingly turned into pills that look like legitimate prescription opioids. These are then smuggled into the United States, the officials say.

;

;Last month, the United States imposed sanctions on 28 people and entities involved with the international proliferation of illicit drugs, including a large China-based network.

;

;"We know that this global fentanyl supply chain, which ends with the deaths of Americans, often starts with chemical companies in China," said US Attorney General Merrick Garland.

;

;Advocates have also accused pharmaceutical companies and related businesses of ;fueling the crisis; through downplaying the risks of opioids and lack of regulation. Landmark settlements since 2021 have set compensation at a total of ;more than $50 billion nationwide;.

;

;Biden is also due to meet with ;Mexican President; Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador in San Francisco. Mexican Foreign Minister Alicia Barcena said talks would include how to better control the arrival from Asia of precursors used to make fentanyl.

;

;In San Francisco, state and local officials have tried to clean up drugs from the city's streets, with limited success. The crisis has drawn sharp criticism from residents in the city, where drug-fuelled crime has forced some businesses to leave.

;

;San Francisco's new district attorney, Brooke Jenkins, has made prosecuting drug dealers a cornerstone of her agenda. The city recently formed a law enforcement task force to investigate opioid-linked deaths and poisonings.

;

;The city's Mayor London Breed has pushed to prioritize treatment for drug users, talked of police action as a way to solve the problem, and has called on the federal government to boost its drug trafficking enforcement.

;

;"We know San Francisco - and cities across the United States - will benefit from more targeting of the trafficking and production of fentanyl worldwide," a spokesperson for Breed said in a statement.

;英国商业和贸易大臣凯米·巴德诺克 (Kemi Badenoch) 周二与佛罗里达州州长罗恩·德桑蒂斯 (Ron DeSantis) 签署了一份谅解备忘录，以促进与美国第四大州的贸易和投资。

;

;巴德诺克表示，英国在与美国联邦政府就更广泛的贸易协定进行谈判方面也取得了进展。

;

;她在电话采访中告诉路透社，她与美国贸易部进行了“非常非常好的对话”代表凯瑟琳·戴 (Katherine Tai) 在最近举行的七国集团 (G7) 会议上讨论了更广泛的协议，并就“相当多”的问题达成了一致。

;

;“我们的目标是很快完成。最后一点通常是最棘手的部分，”她说。 “但进展顺利。”

;

;6 月，英国首相里希·苏纳克和美国总统乔·拜登宣布了《大西洋宣言》，这是一项深化经济、技术和商业联系并扩大当前贸易规模的行动计划。 3100 亿英镑（3800 亿美元）的水平。

;

;然而，英国在前总统唐纳德·特朗普领导下所希望的自由贸易协定 (FTA) 仍然是一个遥远的前景，拜登在将于 2021 年上任。

;

;英国-佛罗里达贸易协定旨在让彼此的公司更容易、更快捷、更便宜地开展业务，重点关注太空、金融技术、人工智能和法律服务，

;

;德桑蒂斯在 4 月份访问伦敦期间会见了巴德诺克，这是他国际访问的一部分，随后他宣布将在 2024 年 11 月的大选中挑战特朗普的共和党总统提名。民意调查显示特朗普是提名的明显领先者。

;

;英国和佛罗里达州之间的贸易额每年已超过 50 亿英镑（61.4 亿美元）。佛罗里达州表示，英国公司在该州创造了超过 70,000 个就业岗位，使英国成为最大的外国投资者，其持有的总资产估计达 180 亿美元。

;

;英国已与其他六个州签署了类似协议，并正在与德克萨斯州、加利福尼亚州、科罗拉多州和伊利诺伊州。巴德诺克将于周三会见加州州长加文·纽瑟姆，讨论该谅解备忘录。

;

;“佛罗里达州本身就是一个主要经济体，其 GDP 高于大多数欧洲国家，”巴德诺克说。 “从发射卫星到开发最新的金融科技软件，佛罗里达州领先的高科技公司为英国快速扩张的科技行业提供了巨大的机会。”

;

;（1 美元 = 0.8149 英镑）

;周二，一场涉及包租巴士、一辆汽车的连锁反应事故造成 6 人死亡、18 人受伤俄亥俄州警方称，俄亥俄州中部的一条高速公路上有一辆拖拉机拖车和其他三辆车。

;

;这辆巴士载着学生和成人陪同人员从俄亥俄州东部的塔斯卡拉瓦斯谷学区前往一个教育会议。据俄亥俄州高速公路巡逻队称，造成 3 人死亡、16 人受伤，其中包括巴士司机。伤者均被送往当地医院。

;

;三名遇难的公交车乘客是学生——两名 18 岁男性和一名 15 岁女孩。高速公路巡逻队在一份声明中称，乘坐参与事故的两辆客车中的一辆的三名成年人也被宣布在现场死亡。

;

;第二辆汽车的司机被带到了医院。医院，还有两名卡车司机之一。警方称，另一人在现场接受治疗并被释放。

;

;事故发生在当地时间上午 9 点前不久，发生在埃特纳镇附近的 70 号州际公路上，该州首府哥伦布以东约 21 英里（34 公里）处。警方称，涉案的五辆车中至少有三辆起火。

;

;没有提供有关事件顺序的详细信息。警方表示，失事原因正在调查中。从事故现场的图像来看，没有迹象表明天气是一个因素。

;

;当地新闻媒体的镜头显示，一辆大型客车似乎被一辆大型卡车从后面撞上，烧焦的车身剩下的就是残骸。卡车旁边还可以看到一辆受损的运动型多功能车。

;

;车上的一些学生是乐队成员，他们计划在俄亥俄州学校董事会协会大会上表演，这是哥伦布的一年一度的活动，以教育为主题据该组织网站称，会议的剩余部分于周日开幕，但在周二发生事故后被取消，据哥伦布快报报道。
